result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan S Pulvermacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs shall be paid as a condition of probation in Ct 2.    If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer to jail convenient to employment or residence.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer to jail convenient to employment or residence.
Consecutive to: Ct 1

miscConds.notes: Costs in Ct 1 & Ct 2 shall be paid as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit random drug screens including blood, breath and urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan S Pulvermacher

Transcript of Academic Record

Def in person & by Atty Anthony D Cotton.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached; State moves to amend Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 to Misd. Possession of THC pursuant to sec. 961.41(3g)(e).  Court requests further explanation from DA regarding pending offer.  Court amends Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 to Misd. Possession of THC pursuant to sec. 961.41(3g)(e).  Guilty plea entered on amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  State takes no position on expungment.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
